file.content:
# Gherkin Scenarios: step-11

## Step Task
## Phase 5.1: Getting Started Guide

Create the primary user documentation:

### Tasks
1. Create docs/getting-started.md:
   - Prerequisites (Claude Code installed, plugin enabled)
   - Installation steps
   - First sign in 5 minutes (quick tutorial)
   - Basic workflow: add -> list -> status
   - Link to how-to guides for more

2. Structure docs/ folder:
   ```
   docs/
     getting-started.md    # Entry point
     how-to/
       add-sign-manually.md
       extract-from-session.md
       review-and-apply.md
       integrate-with-sprint.md
     reference/
       commands.md         # All commands reference
       backlog-format.md   # Schema documentation
   ```

3. Update README.md:
   - Keep it concise (installation + quick example)
   - Add "Documentation" section with link to docs/getting-started.md
   - Add badges if appropriate

### Success Criteria
- Getting started guide is complete and accurate
- New user can add their first sign in < 5 minutes
- docs/ structure is clear and navigable


## Success Criteria
All scenarios must pass (score = 1) for the step to be complete.
Total scenarios: 8
Required score: 8/8

---

## Scenario 1: Getting started guide exists
  Given the documentation structure is set up
  When I check for the main getting started guide
  Then docs/getting-started.md exists in the plugin directory

Verification: `test -f plugins/m42-signs/docs/getting-started.md`
Pass: Exit code = 0 → Score 1
Fail: Exit code ≠ 0 → Score 0

---

## Scenario 2: Getting started guide contains required sections
  Given docs/getting-started.md exists
  When I check for required content sections
  Then the file contains Prerequisites, Installation, Quick Start, and Workflow sections

Verification: `grep -q "## Prerequisites" plugins/m42-signs/docs/getting-started.md && grep -q "## Installation" plugins/m42-signs/docs/getting-started.md && grep -q "add\|list\|status" plugins/m42-signs/docs/getting-started.md`
Pass: Exit code = 0 → Score 1
Fail: Exit code ≠ 0 → Score 0

---

## Scenario 3: How-to guides directory structure exists
  Given the documentation structure is set up
  When I check for the how-to guides directory
  Then docs/how-to/ directory exists with required guide files

Verification: `test -d plugins/m42-signs/docs/how-to && test -f plugins/m42-signs/docs/how-to/add-sign-manually.md && test -f plugins/m42-signs/docs/how-to/extract-from-session.md && test -f plugins/m42-signs/docs/how-to/review-and-apply.md`
Pass: Exit code = 0 → Score 1
Fail: Exit code ≠ 0 → Score 0

---

## Scenario 4: Reference documentation directory exists
  Given the documentation structure is set up
  When I check for the reference documentation directory
  Then docs/reference/ directory exists with commands.md and backlog-format.md

Verification: `test -d plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference && test -f plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/commands.md && test -f plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/backlog-format.md`
Pass: Exit code = 0 → Score 1
Fail: Exit code ≠ 0 → Score 0

---

## Scenario 5: README.md exists with essential content
  Given the plugin root is set up
  When I check for README.md
  Then README.md exists and contains installation instructions and documentation link

Verification: `test -f plugins/m42-signs/README.md && grep -qi "install\|setup\|getting.started" plugins/m42-signs/README.md && grep -q "docs/" plugins/m42-signs/README.md`
Pass: Exit code = 0 → Score 1
Fail: Exit code ≠ 0 → Score 0

---

## Scenario 6: Sprint integration how-to guide exists
  Given the how-to directory is set up
  When I check for sprint integration documentation
  Then docs/how-to/integrate-with-sprint.md exists

Verification: `test -f plugins/m42-signs/docs/how-to/integrate-with-sprint.md`
Pass: Exit code = 0 → Score 1
Fail: Exit code ≠ 0 → Score 0

---

## Scenario 7: Commands reference documents all available commands
  Given docs/reference/commands.md exists
  When I check for command documentation
  Then all core commands (add, list, status, extract, review, apply) are documented

Verification: `grep -q "/m42-signs:add\|add" plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/commands.md && grep -q "/m42-signs:list\|list" plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/commands.md && grep -q "/m42-signs:status\|status" plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/commands.md && grep -q "/m42-signs:extract\|extract" plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/commands.md && grep -q "/m42-signs:review\|review" plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/commands.md && grep -q "/m42-signs:apply\|apply" plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/commands.md`
Pass: Exit code = 0 → Score 1
Fail: Exit code ≠ 0 → Score 0

---

## Scenario 8: Backlog format reference documents YAML schema
  Given docs/reference/backlog-format.md exists
  When I check for schema documentation
  Then the file documents the backlog.yaml structure including learnings array and status field

Verification: `grep -q "backlog.yaml\|backlog\.yaml" plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/backlog-format.md && grep -q "status\|learnings" plugins/m42-signs/docs/reference/backlog-format.md`
Pass: Exit code = 0 → Score 1
Fail: Exit code ≠ 0 → Score 0
